abstract: Apple has created tools for programmers to build interesting applications to run on the iPhone. But all programs must be distributed through Apple, which will take 30 percent of the sale price.
snippet: Apple has created tools for programmers to build interesting applications to run on the iPhone. But all programs must be distributed through Apple, which will take 30 percent of the sale price.
lead_paragraph: Think of Apple as the Singapore of the technology world. It is impeccably clean, very functional, supportive of capitalism — and ruthless with miscreants.

headline.main: Under Apple’s Watchful Eye, Games and Business Applications

abstract: Apple is hoping to expand the iPhone’s appeal by luring software developers to create programs for it.
snippet: Apple is hoping to expand the iPhone’s appeal by luring software developers to create programs for it.
lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif.  Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s chief executive, is hoping to expand the iPhone’s appeal by luring software developers to create programs for it.

abstract: Apple has not made it easy for the iPhone to view most Web video. But the BBC has decided to convert 400 hours a week of programs into Apple’s preferred format to make an iPhone version of its iPlayer video site.
snippet: Apple has not made it easy for the iPhone to view most Web video. But the BBC has decided to convert 400 hours a week of programs into Apple’s preferred format to make an iPhone version of its iPlayer video site.
lead_paragraph: I keep harping on the potential of video on the iPhone, because it is such an attractive video playback device and because this market will show how much Apple will allow other companies with different business models to compete with its own iTunes store.

headline.main: The i’s Have It: The BBC’s iPlayer on the iPhone
